decks.notes: Dimir Tempo focuses on maintaining control of the board while disrupting the opponent's strategy. Utilizing a mix of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and disruptive spells like Thoughtseize, the deck aims to control the pace of the game. Cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent provide additional threats while countermagic like Daze and Force of Will protect your own spells. The deck also utilizes land destruction with Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage, while Nihil Spellbomb and Mishra's Bauble help with card selection and graveyard hate.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then reanimating them with spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate. It also includes cards like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to efficiently cheat powerful threats onto the battlefield early in the game, overwhelming the opponent with creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Additionally, cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower provide additional value and flexibility to the strategy.

The primary goal of this Doomsday combo deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards to win the game in a single turn. Utilizing efficient mana ramp with cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, as well as disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo, the deck aims to cast Doomsday to set up a winning sequence with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection, and Dauthi Voidwalker for disruption. The deck is designed to be fast and resilient, aiming to win before opponents can react.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly get Omniscience onto the battlefield through a combination of cards like Show and Tell, Intuition, and Stock Up. Once Omniscience is in play, the goal is to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn or Atraxa, Grand Unifier for a game-winning advantage. The deck also includes protection with cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to ensure that the combo can go off without interruption. The deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck aims to control the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain board presence. By utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create powerful token creatures, as well as cards like Wasteland and Crop Rotation to disrupt the opponent's mana base, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Life from the Loam and Exploration also provide the deck with card advantage and ramp, allowing it to consistently hit its land drops and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck is focused on utilizing cards like Mystic Forge, Urza's Saga and various artifacts to generate mana and control the board in order to set up a powerful winning combination. By manipulating artifacts and utilizing key cards like Ugin, Tezzeret, and Karn, the deck aims to establish a powerful board presence and overwhelm opponents with an explosive combo finish. Additionally, cards like Portable Hole, Soul-Guide Lantern, and Pithing Needle help disrupt opponents' strategies while cards like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith provide additional mana acceleration to help execute the combo efficiently.

This deck focuses on utilizing multiple fast mana sources and disruptive spells to set up a powerful combo turn that aims to cast a high storm count spell like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to win the game. The deck also makes use of wish effects like Burning Wish and Wishclaw Talisman to access specific cards from the sideboard that can help win the game or disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress also helps to disrupt the opponent's hand and protect the combo.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then bringing them back into play for a strong board presence. It uses a combination of card draw, counterspells, and efficient mana production to set up its powerful reanimation combos. The main goal is to cheat out expensive and game-winning creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory. The deck aims to control the game until it can assemble its key pieces and execute its game-winning strategy.

The following deck revolves around utilizing the combo between Nadu, Nomads en-Kor, and Delighted Halfling to draw through the entire deck and win the game. The deck features plenty of card draw, control, and ramp elements to support the combo and protect it from disruption. The mana base includes dual lands and fetch lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells. The deck also includes additional creatures and utility spells for added versatility and resilience. Ultimately, the goal is to assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with card advantage and powerful interactions.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly get out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier by using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. These creatures can be put into play without paying their mana cost, allowing for a quick and powerful combo. Cards like Omniscience and Brainstorm help with card selection and acceleration, while Force of Will and Veil of Summer provide protection and disruption against opponent's plays. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big, game-changing creatures in a short amount of time.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with Dredge creatures and utilize cards like Faithless Looting and Breakthrough to dig for combo pieces. The goal is to use cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Bridge from Below to create a powerful board state, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Cabal Therapy and Unmask. The deck aims to win quickly through dredging creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and utilizing recursive creatures like Narcomoeba and Poxwalkers. The deck can generate explosive turns and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of graveyard synergy and disruptive elements.

The deck revolves around using a combination of land destruction, hand disruption, and efficient creatures to control the game and grind out advantage. It heavily relies on the synergy between cards like Urza's Saga, Life from the Loam, and Smallpox to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value for itself. The inclusion of Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis and Grist, the Hunger Tide adds a threat that can quickly close out the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outgrind opponents through resource denial and efficient threats.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Brainstorm, and then bringing them back onto the battlefield with Reanimate and Animate Dead. The key strategy is to cheat big creatures into play early on to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can set up their own game plan. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on generating a large amount of mana quickly through various rituals and mana-producing artifacts, then using cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to tutor for and play powerful combo pieces like Tendrils of Agony or Gaea's Will to win the game in one explosive turn. The inclusion of Wishclaw Talisman allows for additional tutoring for key combo pieces. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Veil of Summer to protect the combo and disrupt opponents' gameplans. The deck aims to win the game through a fast and efficient storm combo.

The deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures into the graveyard using cards like Entomb and Reanimate, then bringing them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will to protect the combo. The deck utilizes a mix of reanimation targets, including Murktide Regent and Archon of Cruelty, to apply pressure and close out the game efficiently. It also includes utility cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to provide additional flexibility and card advantage.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with early aggression and disruption. By utilizing powerful creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent, along with efficient spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze, the deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan. The deck also includes card draw and selection spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to help maintain momentum. With a combination of aggression, disruption, and card advantage, this deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively.
